conclusion: Problem involves an electron moving through a uniform electric field between two parallel plates.
Electron is injected with initial velocity perpendicular to electric field and exits at point C with velocity at 30° angle.
Need to find kinetic energy of electron at point C.
Two parallel plates A and B with opposite charges create a uniform electric field.
Electron experiences constant force perpendicular to initial motion due to uniform electric field.
Electron has constant acceleration perpendicular to initial velocity.
Motion can be broken into horizontal motion with constant velocity and vertical motion with constant acceleration.
At point C, velocity has both horizontal and vertical components.
Kinetic energy formula: KE = 1/2 m v^2.
Need to find magnitude of velocity vector at point C.
Horizontal component of velocity v_x = v_0.
Vertical component of velocity v_y due to acceleration from electric field.
Using angle θ = 30°, relate velocity components: tan(θ) = v_y / v_0.
Solve for v_y: v_y = v_0 * tan(30°).
Calculate speed v at point C: v = √(v_x^2 + v_y^2).
